meanings.sent1: She reoffers the toy to her friend after he accidentally drops it.
meanings.sent2: He reoffers his help to his neighbor when she struggles with carrying groceries.
meanings.sent3: The magician reoffers the same card to the audience, hoping for a different reaction this time.
meanings.sent4: The teacher reoffers the challenging assignment, urging the students to give it another try.
meanings.sent5: The shopkeeper reoffers the discount to the customer, hoping to make a sale.

meanings.definition: To present for acceptance or rejection.
meanings.sent1: The real estate agent reoffers the counteroffer to the buyer for consideration.
meanings.sent2: She reoffers her apology to her friend, hoping for forgiveness.
meanings.sent3: The chef reoffers the dish to the customer, asking for feedback on the taste.
meanings.sent4: The company reoffers the job offer to the candidate, emphasizing the benefits.
meanings.sent5: The student reoffers the revised essay to the teacher, eager for approval.

meanings.sent1: He reoffers his idea to the team, hoping they will reconsider.
meanings.sent2: She reoffers her suggestion to the committee, emphasizing its importance.
meanings.sent3: The artist reoffers the painting to the gallery, suggesting a new exhibition theme.
meanings.sent4: The coach reoffers the strategy to the players, believing it will lead to victory.
meanings.sent5: The manager reoffers the proposal to the board, highlighting its potential benefits.
